refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The aq reconfigure command forces a complete rebuild of the configuration of the specified hosts. This includes the tasks of:

listitem.para: re-evaluating all the service bindings
All service bindings will be re-evaluated and possibly changed to new defaults. Also, any services that are not listed as required will be dropped unless the --keepbindings flag is used.
re-writing the plenary template files for the hosts
rebuilding the configuration files on AII bootservers
updating downstream datawarehouses

refsect1.title: Entitlements
refsect1.para: Requires one of the following roles: operations, engineering, winops, winops_server, unixops_l2.

refsect1.title: Templates
refsect1.para: This command may modify: host templates and service templates (if any service bindings are changed).

listitem.para: Only the named HOSTNAME will be reconfigured.

A list of hosts will be read from FILENAME and the given reconfiguration options will be applied equally to all hosts. The format of the file is one hostname per line. Lines that are blank or begin with "#" will be skipped. All hosts must be in the same domain, and after applying all changes the full domain will be compiled.
The --list and --hostlist forms are equivalent, but --hostlist is considered deprecated and should not be used.
Behaves like --list, except the hosts to be reconfigured are the members of CLUSTER.
Name of the OS family to assign to the host (linux, windows, esx, etc.). Generally the osversion will need to be specified as well.
Version of the operating system to run. May require use of the osname parameter if there is ambiguity.
Name and version of the operating system, separated by a slash. This option is deprecated, use the --osname and --osversion options instead.
To change the archetype of a host, a new OS and personality will need to be given.
The name of the personality that should be given to the host. If the operation fails, then the previous personality will remain on the host.
A host lifecycle tends to go from build to ready to decommissioned. After ready, the host might also transition to rebuild.

When --keepbindings is passed, any bindings which have been added manually with bind_client and are not listed as required for the archetype or personality of the host will be kept. The default behavior is --nokeepbindings, which removes any services that are not required.
This option will not change the behavior of enforcing the service maps for required services.
all hosts were successfully reconfigured.
partial success. When specifying a number of hosts (either using the --list or the --membersof options) some of the hosts were successful and some failed.
no hosts were reconfigured.
